content.raw: I'm guessing you're referring to the `MassMatrix3` class that was added in ignition. We could keep some of the same API in the physics::Inertial with pass-through functions (though I would like to see an ignition::math::Inertial returned by at least one function call), but at a minimum we should use the `ignition::math::Inertial` class in the private data structure to reduce code duplication.
content.html: I'm guessing you're referring to the MassMatrix3 class that was added in ignition. We could keep some of the same API in the physics::Inertial with pass-through functions (though I would like to see an ignition::math::Inertial returned by at least one function call), but at a minimum we should use the ignition::math::Inertial class in the private data structure to reduce code duplication.
